organization.name: Médecins Sans Frontières / Doctors Without Borders Canada

travel_requirements.frequency: Quarterly visits to field operations and partner sites

deployment_terms.mobility_requirements: Available for international travel to support telemedicine implementations

responsibilities: Develop comprehensive roadmap for evolution of MSF's Telemedicine services to incorporate case data into living, scalable systems
Lead and manage the Improvement & Innovation Team, including recruitment and development of technical Subject Matter Experts
Establish service standards, design principles, and best practices for telemedicine platform execution
Design and pilot innovative telemedicine initiatives based on systematic evaluation of case data and field requirements
Collaborate closely with Clinical Operations Lead to integrate medical data and clinical contexts from field operations
Direct technical solution development aligned with strategic directives and implementation timelines
Champion service improvements to enhance accessibility and usability of telemedicine services for field teams
Serve as internal technical expert and strategic advisor on MSF's portfolio of telemedicine services
Optimize user experience for healthcare providers in challenging field environments while exploring emerging digital health solutions
Ensure telemedicine solutions align with MSF's humanitarian principles and field operational requirements

specific_experience: Digital health platform development or implementation
Healthcare technology innovation and service design
Team leadership and technical team management
Service improvement methodologies and change management

other_technical: Technology roadmap development and strategic planning
User experience design for healthcare applications
Healthcare compliance and privacy frameworks (HIPAA, GDPR)

soft_skills: Problem-solving and innovation in resource-constrained environments
Stakeholder management across technical and clinical teams
Adaptability to humanitarian contexts and field requirements

preferred_qualifications: Previous experience in humanitarian, international development, or resource-constrained healthcare contexts
Deep knowledge of telemedicine platforms and remote healthcare delivery challenges
Experience with healthcare data privacy, security, and compliance in international contexts
Understanding of clinical workflows and medical decision-making processes
Experience implementing technology solutions in low-resource or challenging environments
Familiarity with MSF operations, humanitarian principles, and field-based healthcare delivery
Experience with mobile health (mHealth) solutions and offline-capable systems
Background in health systems strengthening or global health initiatives

compensation.compensation_philosophy: Competitive compensation aligned with MSF Canada's commitment to fair and equitable remuneration based on internal salary grid system

health_insurance.employer_contribution: Comprehensive coverage with full employer contribution

time_off.parental_leave: Extended parental leave up to 18 months
time_off.r_and_r: Rest and recuperation time following field missions

retirement.plan_type: Group RRSP with pension plan options
retirement.employer_match: Employer contributions as per MSF Canada policy
